title: Honestly, I'd be totally okay with Gunblade being nerfed, as long as it's not losing stats
body:
Big ticket items that you actually feel *good* building are pretty damn rare and finishing your Gunblade feels great as you get an awesome offensive tool that fulfills its niche as *the* hybrid powerspike.

There's a problem though when mages start building it.

They have Deathcap for their late game fantasy and they shouldn't really opt into hybrid itemisation but before you nerf the item's stats consider one(or maybe two) of the following changes to it:

-Nerf the active CD
I don't even know why it was lowered to begin with but 40 seconds for such a big chunk of burst on top of a champion's usual spells is a bit overkill.
Consider raising it to 60ish seconds

-Make it more expensive
Add maybe 200 or so more to its combination cost

-Rework the active
You shouldn't really be building Gunblade as a replacement for the dreaded Deathfire Grasp.
So why not change the active a tad and make it more utility focused for hybrid champions (less/no damage, more slow) or make it a DoT?

-Shift the stats around
Hybrid champions really couldn't care less about the AD and AP values being adjusted so maybe changing them around wouldn't be a bad thing
(Say 60 Ad and 60 AP or something like that)

-Make it Melee only(?)
probably one of the worst suggestions but a lot of the hybrid champions who use it are melee (Akali, Morde, Jax) so maybe it could be something worth considering


Or maybe it's an actual problem with the champion's kit if they have to warp their build to actually function.

Just my two cents on this issue, I really don't like it if my champion's builds get nerfed because of abuse cases.
(Rip old Steraks)

replies.body: The problem isn't that gunblade is op. It's that riot is consistently nerfing AP items. Obviously people are gonna move to new items when you make AP items suboptimal.
When burst mages don't have enough burst they'll obviously itemize for more potential burst. While flat AP items add more damage to their rotation, Gunblade basically gives them an entire new spell.

exactly this ^

It's an entire new spell with base damage and ap ratio 

it's what people have been doing since the ap value nerfs, they look for actives/passive to increase their ap ratio's and kit burst
with items like {{item:3146}} {{item:3030}} {{item:3152}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3115}} 


Obviously not all these are going to be built together but look at it this way


if i built gunblade i get an extra 250 base damage and 30% ap ratio
I already have TLD for 180 base damage and 10% ap ratio and 30% ad ratio(gunblade gives AD so synergy is there)
I now grab ludens for extra 100 base damage and 10% ap ratio
I then grab Lich bane for 75% base ad base damage and 50% ap ratio


I just gained 100% ap ratio's 30% ad ratio's in my kit from just the items themsleves thats 260 ap and 40 ad therefore i gained 272 additional damage
on top of 75% base ad lets make that 75 damage for simplicity sake, as well as 180, 100 and 250 damage

overal i gained 877 additional burst from item actives/passives and keystone

Thats insane

i now also get to grab 3 more items all of which are going to increase my damage on my actives/passives

an extra deathcap for example will increase damage at this point by 253 on my actives/passives let's also add a voidtsaff

and now im dealing an extra 1238 burst damage with a build like

{{item:3020}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} 


mages complain about having less ap but gaining these amounts of extra burst they really can't complain 

they are dealing upwards of 3k burst sometimes as high has 3,5/4k 

land your stun dump everything on their face and insta delete people

When you say

> mages complain about having less ap but gaining these amounts of extra burst they really can't complain 

With a build that looks like:

{{item:3020}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} 

It tells me you dont really play mages.

**First**, not enough mana; 250 from Lich B... Pretty much every mage has to build some mana and mana sustain. 250 isnt enough, and it offers no sustain for mana.

**Second**, only 10% CDR... again on Lich B. I guess not being able to spam any of your spells will help since your going to be mana starved.

**Third**, no HP, mages are squishy, and they can be killed very quickly. Its why many of their items come with HP, so they can live long enough to take a hit or two to get a rotation off.

**Fourth**, that build will put most mages into a range they arnt safe at. Coupled with the above point that it offers no additional survivability the nesesity to get close enough for Gunblade and Lich B. aa proc will get them killed. If it will get them killed to get that close they cant make use of it.

So you put together items for a mage that will offer them not enough mana, not enough CDR, no health, and requires them to put themselves to close to the action and say they cant complain... OK, I LOL'd.

A significant portion of the build (to get extra burst) revolves around Lich B. Its not a good item on most mages. "But {{champion:115}} he duz eet" Yes, and Ziggs has an aa that burns down towers hard, and Lich B. works on towers, it works for him to siege faster. He isnt using it on people as much as towers.The main reason you dont see Lich B. on most mages is because their AA is just for killing minions and hitting towers. Lich B. is for AP assassins/fighters like Fizz & Diana.

Good luck with that build on any mage not named leblanc. You need morello's for mana or else you will be useless if you can't burst someone down due to mana issues and lack of cdr.

In the case of protobelt, it was added as a mage mobility option, but it's only ever bought for the extra burst (and because Vlad really likes its stats). It needs at least some work done, at this point.
I just wish the ap would be higher on zhonyas and maybe another 120 ap item
Nah. When zhonyas had 120 AP it was a core item for every AP champ. At 70 AP and a cheaper price its more of a niche item that you buy when you really need the active.
i personally wish they'd just add blackfire and deathfire back to the game. along with will of the ancients.
I to wish for WoA to come back but it would shift the meta back to Vlad Swain every game.

spell vamp is still in the game. they can build hextec and still lifedrain. all taking it out did was mutilate the champs like morgana that needed it for their kit. if you've ever wondered why her stuns are so long... well there you go.
morgana needs a better passive tho

Hextech Gunblade now gives "Omni-vamp" which heals 15% of all damage done and reduced for AoE. Technically not spell vamp but technicalities don't matter. Spell vamp also survives in the runes for some reason xD you can buy spell vamp quints I believe.
it's also in the mastery trees under the red tree and the green tree.
To be fair since so many AP items have lost their AP ({{item:3116}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3157}} ) its no wonder people get it
I still think Rylai's should build out of 2 blasting wands instead of a Needlessly Large Rod + Book.
Rylais doesn't build out of needlessly large rod, and has less AP than 2 blasting wands.

I can't specify this enough! Not to mention AD is going up on a lot of items in Midseason. Adaptive Helm is getting added so dps mages get nerfed and AP champs now lose the option of building guardian angel. The constant nerfs to AP over the seasons is just unreal.
I can't think of any ranged champs that should be building it. For once, making it melee only doesn't seem like that bad of an idea.

{{champion:17}} {{champion:10}}.

Possibly Kennen and Twisted Fate too.

Yes, but these champs don't rely on gunblade in their typical build, especially not TF and Kennen. Both Teemo and Kayle have plenty of other items that go into their core build that gunblade isn't a necessity, nor would they be heartbroken if it became melee only. Meanwhile there are plenty of melee champs that rely on gunblade as a core item and build it almost every game (Kat, Akali, Morde, etc). If they wouldn't want to commit to making it melee only maybe they could make the active weaker for ranged champs, like a lesser slow or a lower base damage.
{{item:3146}} is core af on hybrid {{champion:10}}. Which imo is one of her best build paths: {{item:3115}}{{item:3006}}{{item:3124}}{{item:3146}}
Gunblade is the only item that heals you for your onhit damage, and lots of hybrid chams have onhits.

> [{quoted}](name=Frightning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ngdx7qEJ,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-17T03:11:31.672+0000)

That's garbage and no one who plays Kayle seriously builds gunblade.

As a 300,000 mastery Kayle main I can tell you that you are very wrong.

{{item:3115}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3085}} is Kayle's core.

Gunblade is situational.

I went ahead and tested this versus my build in the Practice Tool. Some interesting data:
-It does not appear that the splash is applied by the bolts, as I suspected.
That said, I did 2 tests:
Test 1: Single target DPS
Test 2: Splash+Runaan's bolts v just Splash (my build)

For both tests, I set myself to level 14, and maxed E, Q, and had 2 points in W and R, I only used E for the tests however.
I would stand in melee range and DPS the target dummy, running threw a few cycles of the entire E duration and brief remainder of CD to get a good average DPS, for the 2nd test, I had 3 dummies right next to each other so that I could compare splash as well.

Findings:
Single target DPS: For your build was about 550, for my build, it was about 500. So you have a 10% advantage in single target DPS.
Splash: In the splash test, main target DPS mirror single target DPS for both builds (this shows that {{item:3085}} bolts do _not_ apply Righteous Fury splash), the Secondary targets would take both Runaan's bolts and splash from the main target. Total DPS to them was about 500 with your build, and about 250 with mine (just splash). This means that with your build, DPS from Runaan's bolts and from splash was about 50-50 to secondary targets (provided, ofc, that they are within the 150 radius of the main target).

Conclusion:
Although your build does possess higher DPS, it's only by about 10%, and you have no healing what so ever in the item build. I have 15% healing from all damage (1/3 effective on AoE damage), which means that I would've been healing approximately 75 HP/S due to my DPS against the target dummy. Without even factoring in armor and magic resist, this is enough that my build would win a duel with yours (your effective DPS if I had 0 resists would be less than mine, and I actually had about 70 ar and 30 mr). This, while also having more AP, and hence better damage with Q, better healing and MS from W, and the synergy of being able to healing from my DPS while ulting myself (plus the handy active, which adds to my burst, slows, and also heals me for 15% of its damage). All things put together, I think the numbers and tests came out pretty strongly in my build's favor. That said, there's no reason not to still consider {{item:3085}} as 5th item after {{item:3146}}.

Ok so Hurricane gives 10% more DPS, faster rageblade stacking (which is VERY VERY NEEDED) and massive AoE damage.

Need I explain more?

The conditions in which your build actually outperforms mine are quite specific and not necessarily all that common in a real game. (how often do multiple important targets stay within 150 range of each other when you are DPSing them down? Also, I didn't factor in higher Q dmg, or greater W heal (and MS) amount that my build provides, nor the benefits of the active on gunblade. I suspect some of the DPS difference against a single target would be recouped, and, the higher burst is favorable when dealing with squishy enemies. Reality is that both builds are good (and getting both {{item:3085}} and {{item:3146}} is a fine idea anyways (and still leaves the last item slot for {{item:3026}})
Gunblade on teemo has been core for a while now.
{{item:3145}} is too strong on teemo to ignore, he only builds gunblade because it is the best upgrade path on him out of the 3 options.

Lol.  Okay.  Are we just ignoring that teemo is one of like 3 champions in the game who can build hybrid, and also that this is one of two hybrid items that exist?


Teemo builds it because he needs sustain just like any other Marksman and this allows him to sustain off of poison and shrooms on minion waves.
Plus the active is nice for peel, considering that his only mobility is a MS buff.

The primary 3 are Kayle, Teemo and Evelynn.

(Ex: AP would limit his AA power, AD would limit his W powerr)

No one who mains any of those champions builds gunblade, and the only one where it would be reasonable is Teemo. The rest all have far better options.

what if the active played up on it being a gun_blade_ and had some alternate effect when used in melee 

mages would probably still be using deathcap often if we hadn't been steadily removing AP from items and AP ratios from mages

Is the only thing you think about juggernauts?

You are forgetting the _gun_ of _gun_blade.

You just made Gunblade a pure AD item for more burst.
do explain to me how "what if it did something different in melee range" is in any way related to juggernauts or making it a "pure AD item"
Play on words, you were talking about the BLADE part of Gunblade, but it IS a GUN-BLADE so it would have both Melee and Range portions of an active. And Mages dont use Guns, so why have it be AP?
Because Hextech is magical.
And it comes full circle

You know, when you think about it, it's a Hextech Gun-Blade. That's one part magic from "Hextech" and two parts physical from the "Gun" and the "Blade". But its stats are one part physical (40 AD) and two parts magical (80AP, 2x the AD)! Shouldn't it be reversed?
You're right

> [{quoted}](name=Skorch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ngdx7qEJ,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-04-17T14:02:58.403+0000)
>
> Play on words, you were talking about the BLADE part of Gunblade, but it IS a GUN-BLADE so it would have both Melee and Range portions of an active. And Mages dont use Guns, so why have it be AP?

Are you really trying to use real world physical logic in this game? Seriously?

Going off the idea, what if we separate the damage and slow portion, with an additional mark effect.

Something like an active range the same as now that does 25% damage it does currently, but applies the slow, and marks the target for a few seconds.  If you melee auto attack that target while they are marked you deal damage equal to the live value, and maybe ignore x% of their resists on the second chunk of damage, helping hybrid champs out a lil' bit on the damage side to make up for it being riskier and backloaded?  

Dunno if the resist ignoring part is even needed, but I wanted a way to make the damage more valuable because it now has a much larger risk associated with it, and actual counter play beyond not getting within range, but at the same time, I don't think the damage value itself should be increased much if at all.
I know that Kat, LB and Akali build it. What other mages build it, just curious?
Currently Leblanc is "abusing" it as well as Ahri starting to pick it up more often.
